events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident occurring on April 30th involving a rear-end collision at a traffic light intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under 'Auto Accident' based on the description of a vehicle collision and damages reported.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to assist the customer and guide through the claim process regarding their auto accident.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the claim for the vehicle collision and confirmed next steps to the claimant.
Request sent to the claimant for police report, photos of the car damage, and medical bills related to the accident.
Customer submitted all requested documents including accident photos, police report, and initial medical treatment receipts.
The investigation team began reviewing all evidence related to the auto accident to verify claim validity and extent of damages.
Investigation concluded indicating the claimant was not at fault and confirming the reported damages from the collision.
A settlement amount was proposed covering vehicle repairs, medical expenses, and rental car charges during the repair period.
The claimant provided positive feedback on communication and timely updates received throughout the settlement offer process.
Formal approval was granted to proceed with the settlement payment after customer agreement on the proposed compensation.
The settlement payment was issued successfully to the claimantâ€™s bank account covering all approved costs related to the auto accident.
The claim file was officially closed following payment disbursal and confirmation of claimant satisfaction with the compensation.
The entire claim case documentation and investigation records were archived in compliance with company retention policies.
